[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: interner] [Memory exhaustion] Does the 'interner' module's public API allow unbounded string interning, enabling attackers to exhaust validator memory by creating millions of unique interned strings during transaction execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: loaded_data] [Type confusion] Can the 'loaded_data' module expose internal type metadata that attackers manipulate to cause type confusion attacks, bypassing Move's type safety and enabling resource theft? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: module_id_interner] [Collision attack] Does the 'module_id_interner' expose hash table internals that can be exploited to create module ID collisions, allowing malicious modules to impersonate system modules like account or coin? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: natives] [Native function abuse] Can the public 'natives' module API be misused to invoke native functions with invalid arguments, bypassing Move VM safety checks and causing undefined behavior in Rust native code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: resolver] [State inconsistency] Does the 'resolver' module's public API allow external code to bypass transactional semantics when resolving on-chain state, potentially causing non-atomic state updates and double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: ty_interner] [Type system bypass] Can the 'ty_interner' module's type interning be exploited to create invalid type signatures that bypass Move's borrow checker, enabling use-after-free bugs in resource management? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: value_serde] [Deserialization attack] Does the public 'value_serde' module properly validate deserialized Move values, or can attackers craft malicious serialized data that causes integer overflows, buffer overflows, or arbitrary code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: value_traversal] [Infinite recursion] Can the 'value_traversal' module be exploited with deeply nested or circular Move values to cause stack overflow during traversal, crashing validator nodes and causing loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: values] [Resource safety violation] Does the public 'values' module API enforce Move's linear resource semantics, or can it be misused to duplicate resources (double-spend coins) or drop resources without proper destruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Module: views] [Confidentiality breach] Can the 'views' module expose internal VM state through public view functions, leaking sensitive information like private account balances, pending transactions, or validator keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Cross-module: code + instr] [Bytecode validation gap] Can inconsistencies between the 'code' and 'instr' module's bytecode representations allow attackers to construct bytecode that passes validation in one module but executes incorrectly in another? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Cross-module: gas + values] [Gas calculation bypass] Can the interaction between 'gas' metering and 'values' operations be exploited to perform expensive value operations without consuming proportional gas, enabling DoS attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Cross-module: resolver + loaded_data] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Can time-of-check-time-of-use race conditions between 'resolver' state queries and 'loaded_data' access allow double-spending by exploiting transaction execution parallelism? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Cross-module: interner + ty_interner] [Hash collision] Do the 'interner' and 'ty_interner' modules use the same hash function (potentially sha3_256()), and can hash collisions between string identifiers and type signatures cause type confusion attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Cross-module: natives + resolver] [Privilege escalation] Can native functions invoked through the 'natives' module bypass 'resolver' access controls to directly modify protected system state (validator set, governance parameters)? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: version mismatch] If different validators run different versions of move-vm-types with incompatible sha3_256() implementations or module APIs, can this cause consensus failures and network partitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: unsafe code] Do any of the exported modules use unsafe Rust code that could be exploited through the public API surface exposed by lib.rs to achieve arbitrary code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: dependency vulnerabilities] Are the sha3 crate and other dependencies used by move-vm-types pinned to specific versions, or can dependency confusion attacks substitute malicious crates that compromise validator security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: panic safety] Do the exported modules properly handle panics, or can attacker-triggered panics in any module propagate through lib.rs and crash validator processes during consensus-critical operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: feature flags] Does lib.rs or its modules use conditional compilation (cfg flags) that change API behavior between build configurations, potentially causing consensus incompatibility between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Library: re-export security] Can malicious crates declare dependencies on move-vm-types and re-export modified versions of its types to create supply-chain attacks affecting downstream Aptos components? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Function: sha3_256()] [Empty input handling] Does sha3_256() correctly handle empty byte slices (zero-length input), and can this be exploited if used for transaction hashing to create transactions with identical hashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Function: sha3_256()] [Memory alignment] Can misaligned byte slice inputs to sha3_256() cause performance degradation or incorrect hash computation on architectures with strict alignment requirements? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Function: sha3_256()] [Partial hash exposure] If sha3_256() is interrupted mid-computation (e.g., by async cancellation), can partial hash state leak through memory, enabling length-extension attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/lib.rs] [Function: sha3_256()] [Replay protection] Is sha3_256() used for transaction replay protection, and can weaknesses in its implementation allow transaction replay attacks across different epochs or chains? (High)
